heaviest_rainfall.status: The most intense rainfall recorded took place on 04 January 2025, with precipitation totalling 36.8mm.  The rain fell at 4.6mm per hour at times over the course of the 37.2 hour storm.

heaviest_rainrate.status: 27.0mm per hour is the maximum rain rate ever recorded on 02 September 2025, during a 15.0 hour storm which dumped 21.19mm of rain from the clouds.

longest_rain.status: The storm today ranked 5th for the length of the storm when compared to others in our records and it lasted 22.9 hours.  7.68mm of rain fell and at one point was falling at 4.1mm per hour.  The lengthiest precipitation event recorded spanned 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025, it was characterized by a peak rain intensity of 4.6mm per hour and a total rainfall of 36.8mm.

most_lightning.status: Since 11 April 2025, the day with the most lightning strikes is 07 September 2025 when 23 were seen.

storm.status: A storm is in the area.  This is the first such event since 02 October 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: Currently, the weather is stable with no cold snap in progress.  So far, 6 cold snaps have been recorded this year.  The average yearly count is 3.7.

extreme.status: The maximum temperature difference seen is 26.7°C, observed on 29 April 2025 when the temperature fell to 0.4°C but also managed to reach 27.1°C on the same day.

heatwaves.status: There is not a heatwaves right now.  There have been 6 this year, compared to a usual average of 1.9.

tropical.status: The most recent tropical night was on 18 July 2025 and this has only occurred 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is south-westerly (204°).  In the UK, a south-westerly wind often means mild and wet weather.

gusts.status: To date, the maximum wind gust recorded is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The record wind run remains at 1737 miles from 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The largest wind speed ever was on 13 October 2012 with a value of 93.7 mph.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 6.6°C) and outside temperature (down 4.5°C) and drier conditions in outside humidity (down 10%) and rainfall (down 0.3 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in rainfall (up 0.3 mm).

The past week and month had observable variation in rainfall (down 0.2 mm), cloud levels (up 282 m), and light levels (up 4145 lux) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 710.1m higher than yesterday, 165.2m lower than the past week, 282.4m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels for yesterday ranged from 568m to 931m and averaged 1439.6m, while the past week and month indicated warmer conditions.
cloud levels.summary: Clouds will be high, allowing good sunlight.

summary.summary: Inside; anticipate mild and comfortable temperatures. Outside; moderate and mild. Also, air moisture should feel ok and little or no wind. Possible light showers, clouds will be high, allowing good sunlight, and moderate levels of sunlight will be present. Changeable conditions.

washing.phrase: The conditions are favourable for drying your laundry outside right now but, as always, monitor the situation for changes to the weather.
